com.oblong.gspeak
Class Substrate

java.lang.Object
  com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate

public class Substrate
extends java.lang.Object

Your basic library object that sets up a server for communicating with pointing devices and parses incoming data from those devices. This class connects to the "remote" Pool of g-speak Slaw data and neatly parses the information into a collection of Pointers.

The Substrate class provides an API for configuring a Processing sketch to parse pointing device data, advertising a server to connect to, and managing a collection of Pointer objects.

To start the substrate server, create a Substrate instance in your sketch's setup method:

Substrate substrate;

void setup () {
  substrate = new Substrate (this);
}

Author:
oblong industries, inc.

Constructor Summary
Substrate(processing.core.PApplet parent)
          Our default constructor creates an object that listens for events and parses data from a remote set of pointing devices, starts a server to listen for the events on port 65456, and creates the Pools (data resources) needed for the pointing device to send data if they do not already exist.

Field Detail

pointers

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Pointer> pointers
A map of device names to their Pointer abstractions. Accessing the Set of values from this object is a good way to iterate over all known Pointer objects.

Constructor Detail

Substrate

public Substrate(processing.core.PApplet parent,
                 boolean run_pool_tcp_server)
Creates an object that listens for events and parses data from a remote set of pointing devices, but only creates a data server if run_tcp_server is true and there isn't already one running.

Parameters:
parent - the Processing PApplet we're currently servicing
run_pool_tcp_server - if true, we also start a pool TCP server on port 65456 in a new thread and create the remote and remote-data pools. If this argument is false, no pool_tcp_server is started and the programmer must start the server another way (this can come in handy for running two sketches on the same machine).

Substrate

public Substrate(processing.core.PApplet parent)
Our default constructor creates an object that listens for events and parses data from a remote set of pointing devices, starts a server to listen for the events on port 65456, and creates the Pools (data resources) needed for the pointing device to send data if they do not already exist.

Parameters:
parent - the processing PApplet we're currently servicing.

Substrate

public Substrate(processing.core.PApplet parent,
                 java.lang.String service_name)
Creates an object that listens for events and parses data from a remote set of pointing devices. If we're not currently running a data server, we also start one with the name provided to this constructor.

Parameters:
parent - the parent processing PApplet we're currently servicing
service_name - how the service will present itself to the outside world via zeroconf / avahi / bonjour or whatever your system is using.

depositImage

public void depositImage(processing.core.PImage img,
                         java.lang.String where)
Deposits an image into a pool. Useful for sending images between applications.

Parameters:
img - The image to deposit
where - The URI of the pool to deposit into

requestImage

public void requestImage(java.lang.String fromWhom)
Sends a message to the device powering the given Pointer that the application would like to receive an image from the Pointer. The device should then display an interface asking the user to take a photo. The image can be accessed through the imageIngested(PImage p) method.

Parameters:
fromWhom - the provenance of an iOS pointer

requestImage

public void requestImage(Pointer fromWhom)
Sends a message to the device powering the given Pointer that the application would like to receive an image from the Pointer. The device should then display an interface asking the user to take a photo. The image can be accessed through the imageIngested(PImage p) method.

Parameters:
fromWhom - the Pointer that is the recipient of the request

drawPointers

public void drawPointers()
Draw all the pointers we're currently aware of. A convenience method to see something quickly.

depositProtein

public void depositProtein(Protein p,
                           java.lang.String where)
non-throwing method for depositing proteins

Parameters:
p - the protein to deposit
where - the fully qualified name of the pool to write into

toSlaw

public Slaw toSlaw(processing.core.PImage img)
Returns a PImage as Slaw. Original image is unmodified.

Parameters:
img -
Returns:
a slaw containing the bytes of the img

toSlaw

public Slaw toSlaw(processing.core.PImage img,
                   java.lang.String tmpFile)
Returns a PImage as Slaw, suitable for depositing in a Pool. Writes the image to file in order to perform PNG encoding.

Parameters:
img - The image to convert to Slaw
tmpFile - Location for the image to be saved on disk
Returns:
a Slaw containing a byte array of the image data.
